Now, there is a  huge risk in that, because what if  they are real and she still doesn't  feel the same for you?  It will hurt  like a bitch, but at least you'll  know, and you can stop putting  yourself out there.  Even though  that's a worst case scenario, there  is a positive side to it, because  you will definitely get closure either  way.

I hate being alone.

dialogues.text: A cat wanders into the room.  Casey picks it up and cradl it like a baby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a stupid cat aren't you? You're  just stoopid, huh? Yeah, you're just  a big baby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He is again trying to write something.  He looks relative happy and is messing around, typing on the computer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what do you want to listen to?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something sexy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something sexy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Melissa smiles.  They begin to dance.  Daniel picks her u like you would carry a baby and takes her to the bed. The fall onto it and start making out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daniel and Melissa are lying in bed together.  The sheets are messed up and Daniel has his arm around her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you feel?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Melissa smiles and snuggles into Daniel, burying her head little in the crook of his arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good... how do you feel?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alive?  What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I feel energized, full of life, ready  to take on the world.  What do you  want to today?  Let's go for a walk,  or even better, go hiking?  Wait.  What about a road trip?  San Francisco  would be fun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Um, no, hello.  I have to go to school  and then back home so my parents  won't suspect anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What would happen if your parents  found out about me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well... that's not going to happen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But what would happen if they did?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They would freak and probably try to  prosecute you.  My mom would be more  likely to be okay with it, but my  dad would absolutely freak.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Melissa hurries out of the school and begins her walk hom

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daniel is drinking an energy drink and staring into a not book.  He is attacking it with the pen and writing very  rapidly.  He stops, looks around, smiles and continues to write. FADE TO BLACK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clarissa and Melissa are hanging out after school.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know Justin likes you right?   He's totally cute.  I bet he asks  you to Homecoming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiles) Maybe, but I probably won't go with  anybody.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know why; I think I'm in love  with Daniel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in a teasing voice) I can't believe you had sex with  him, you're such a slut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clarissa!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just kidding! Well, you should at  least bring him sometime when we all  hang out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you think that would be weird?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, but I want to meet him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But what if my parents find out?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you really think you can hide it  from them forever?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daniel is drinking another caffeine drink and writing.  H is typing on his laptop once again. CELL PHONE RINGS. Daniel answers it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daniel, I'm pregnant. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INTERCUT telephone conversation. Daniel is shocked. He fumbles a bit and rubs his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (fast and nervously) Oh my god... shit... are you okay?  Are you alright?  Where are you?  I'll come pick you up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't right now. My parents are  home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't care about that. I need to  see you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. I-I just can't.  I'll be  okay, honestly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, you won't, you're pregnant.   What are we going to do... oh my god  my life could be over... let me come  get you... go away with me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop talking crazy, Daniel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you think about an abortion?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What-!? Damn, my mom is calling me,  I'll call you back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MELISSA hangs up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PHONE is DEAD. Melissa is no longer on the line. Daniel i still holding the phone in shock. FADE TO BLACK.

dialogues.speaker: DANIEL'S POV
dialogues.text: A dingy floor, a beer bottle, a notebook of scribbles.  A feeling of uneasiness.

dialogues.speaker: SLURP CHUG SPLASH
dialogues.text: A shaky hand sets down a beer bottle.

dialogues.speaker: THUD THUD THUD
dialogues.text: Someone is walking heavily down a stair case nearby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He has a soccer ball in hand and a slightly exasperated  expression as he approaches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dude what's going on, I've been  looking for you for like the last  ten minutes.  You're not in your  room

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (interrupting) Melissa's pregnant.  Fuck man, what  the fuck am I going to do? (pacing back and forth  nervously)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Man, are you sure she's pregnant

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what she told me... my life's  over.  She's mad at me, her parents  are going to find out... I'm going  to jail... I'm a fucking idiot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in a more serious,  calming voice) Calm down Daniel. Make sure its for  real and that she takes a pregnancy  test.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why do you keep saying that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Cause girls are wrong about that  sometimes or they tell you that to  get a rise out of you.  It's happened  to me a few times and they never  ended up being pregnant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, Melissa isn't like that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trust me, ask her to take a pregnancy  test at Planned Parenthood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Won't her parents find out for sure  then?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's anonymous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daniel continues to drink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trust me, you'll be alright.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daniel is stumbling around drunk. He calls MELISSA'S PHON it RINGS five times, then her VOICE MAIL comes on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (In a drunken slur) Melissa I'll take care of you.  Don't  worry about anything.  I have money.  We'll be happy. Run away with me... (more drunken,  incoherent slur)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daniel walks up to Melissa on a park bench and immediatel gives her a passionate hug.  She hugs him back and they p in each other's arms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I missed you

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I missed you, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They talk for several minutes in hushed voices, but they agitated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not pregnant?  What the fuck!  Why did you lie to me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't lie! I wasn't sure...  I  thought I was because my period was  a week and a half late...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want a fantasy, this is real.  The guy you want doesn't exist.   This isn't a fucking movie.  This is  real; I'm real.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know what I want...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, and what is that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God, I don't know, but not this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well... at least this way life is  interesting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a mess, Daniel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daniel is again drinking beer.  He's pacing back and fort looking very nervous.  He's  looking at a small black jew box. FADE TO BLACK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He is drinking more beer and looking over some text.  He rough-shaven and looks depressed. He is editing something the computer for awhile.  He presses print.

dialogues.speaker: COMPUTER SCREEN
dialogues.text: Printing page 1 of 550.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: It finishes printing and Daniel sighs and puts the pages  together in order. He continues drinking more of his beer He makes a large stack and then assembles them. He pulls out  the black jewelry box and reveals a beautif ring.  He puts both the manuscript and the ring in a pack

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daniel walks to a post office drop off box and drops the  package in. FADE TO BLACK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She is looking through her mail and sees a big package. opens it and takes out both the jewelry box and the ring. She begins to read.

dialogues.speaker: MELISSA READING
dialogues.text: She reads the whole thing. There are tears in her eyes. looks at the ring and puts it on her finger. MELISSA CALL Daniel.  His PHONE RINGS six times before the ANSWERING  MACHINE PICKS UP.  She doesn't leave a message. She gets  dressed and leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Melissa gets in her car and drives to Daniel's place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She walks down the hallway and knocks on his door. Daniel answers, he is holding another beer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi.  You're still awake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (soft and slowly) I've been going through a little  insomnia again lately. Did you get  my package?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (emotionally) Daniel, it is beautiful.  That's the  most beautiful thing anyone has ever  given me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm glad you liked it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I loved it... whats that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She points to the beer in his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why do you care?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why do I-you know what, whatever.  Bye --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reaching out and  grabbing her hand) Melissa, wait... I'm sorry (hugs her)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're an alcoholic. And I do care,  because I love you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I prefer drunk... but yes I know.   And I'm working on that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How?  By drinking yourself to death.   You know what Daniel? I think you do  get scared.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not amounting to anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alcohol is your escape. It allows  you to avoid doing anything useful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks hopeless. He touches her arm, but she shakes hi off and walks quickly down the hall. She's sobbing now. H watches her go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Melissa is in her bedroom and puts Daniel's manuscript in large manila envelop. She puts a bunch of stamps on it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MR. JONES comes home holding a heavily stamped envelope  containing the manuscript. He goes to the kitchen and beg to make himself something to eat. He sets it down on the counter.  After making his food, h looks at it again.  He's a little bewildered and opens th envelope.  It contains the manuscript and a small note. H picks up the note.

dialogues.speaker: NOTE
dialogues.text: It is a note, ostensibly from Daniel WESTON.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: MR. JONES frowns a little, shrugs and sits down on the co manuscript in hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MR. JONES in the middle of reading the paper.  While he's reading we hear Daniel'S VOICE OVER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She was an angel, about to get her  first taste of mortality, the  realization that it wouldn't last  forever.  That incredible feeling...  that you're free. You want to feel  every tiny fiber of your limited  existence... to dwell in an emotional  sandstorm, to be so flushed with the  human experience that if even if  death came in the preceding seconds,  you would smile, for you knew you  were really, truly alive once. Mr.  Jones picks up the phone and dials.  He speaks to someone on the other  end.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi Rob - I've just received a very  interesting manuscript.  I'm going  to send it to you to read. I know we  don't normally look at anonymous  submissions, but you have to read  this; it's great.

dialogues.speaker: PHONE RINGS
dialogues.text: It's an executive from Mr. Jones' publishing company.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, is this Daniel Weston?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is the Senior Vice President  for Aldor Publishing and we've  received your submission...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Jones is excited.  He knocks on Melissa's door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MELISSA opens the door and MR. JONES enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey honey, how was your day?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pretty good actually.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She runs her hand through her hair and Mr. Jones sees the ring.

dialogues.speaker: MR. JONES
dialogues.text: His face looks pinched, as if he's just realizing somethi He remembers Daniel describing the ring to his lover in t manuscript, and the description of the lover.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calmly, but you can  tell something's  wrong) Where did you get that ring Melissa?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking uncomfortable) Um... I just got it at the mall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Jones looks at her for a moment, turns and walks away He stops at her door and turns to her again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give Daniel my regards, won't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Melissa looks shocked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daddy --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Jones interrupts her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How did this happen?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Melissa is in her room lying on the bed with the pillow o her head. We hear the VOICES of her Mr. Jones and Mrs. Jo YELLING at each other in the back ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't believe this happened.  That  we were so god-damned blind.  We  have to do something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We were so stupid... I was stupid...  You were stupid.  Clarissa's house  my ass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Melissa calls Daniel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daniel knocking at the door, well-groomed and nicely dres

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reaches the front door and opens it. Sees Daniel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello?  Can I help you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, I'm Daniel Weston. I need to  speak with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (barely controlling  her anger) Honey that man's here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Jones walks to the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daniel Weston.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Jones looks at Daniel and doesn't say anything for a  minute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why are you here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I please just speak with you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Jones and Mrs. Jones look at each other. Mr. Jones lo extremely angry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So speak.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please, can I come in?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Jones knows her husband will probably yell. She look outside nervously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Homey, please, I don't want the  neighbors to see or hear what's going  on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine. You've got five minutes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daniel sits facing Mr. and Mrs. Jones, trying to explain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you're going to prosecute me,  then do it, but know that I do love  your daughter.  I never intended  this. I just met her and couldn't  help falling in love with her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's only 16.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know, but that didn't change my  heart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You like my work.  Just because I  was inspired by your daughter doesn't  mean it's any less valid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daniel is leaving.  You hear Melissa calling his name and her parents yelling.

dialogues.speaker: SHOT
dialogues.text: Melissa rushes through the house and out the door, still  calling his name.  Daniel looks into her eyes and smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry, they won't prosecute.   And we can still see each other...  well at least talk...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiling sadly) We'll see. I love you Melissa. And  thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (touches her face,  kisses her, and pulls  away) Everything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daniel lets her go and squeezes her hand. He turns and wa away. FADE TO BLACK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daniel is looking good and dressed very maturely, sitting a desk. He's online and typing to Melissa.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Melissa is smiling, and replying to Daniel. INTERCUT chat conversation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's New York?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very cold, but good...
